question:
Pure Honey:
1. is slightly acidic
2. releases Hydrogen peroxide slowly
3. is a supersaturated liquid
Which among the above is / are correct?
explanation: Honey has Glucose Oxidase enzyme which releases Hydrogen peroxide as follows: C<sub>6</sub>H<sub>12</sub>O<sub>6</sub> + H<sub>2</sub>O + O<sub>2</sub> - C<sub>6</sub>H<sub>12</sub>O<sub>7</sub> + H<sub>2</sub>O<sub>2 </sub> All statements in this question are correct. In Pure Honey, water is generally not available. Honey has an acidic pH.
